items.title: Maha Kumbh LIVE: Hindu devotees gather for festival in India
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Live from Prayagraj as millions of Hindu devotees gather in the north Indian state of Uttar Pradesh for the Maha Kumbh festival, said to be the largest religious congregation on Earth.

Nearly 400 million people are expected to participate in the festival between Jan.13 and Feb.26 for a series of ritual baths at the confluence of the Ganges, the Yamuna and the mythical Saraswati rivers. Hindu faithful believe the holy dip will cleanse them of their past sins and end their process of reincarnation. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3DT6gGq

#india #hindu #mahakumbh2025

items.title: Biden says he's leaving Trump with a 'very strong hand to play'
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
In the final foreign policy address of his administration, President Joe Biden touted his accomplishments, insisting his presidency has restored American credibility on the world stage and cemented the U.S. as an indispensable partner around the globe. Read more: https://bit.ly/42cbFT7 

#biden #news #trump 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress

items.title: LIVE: Aftermath of wildfires in Pasadena, California
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Live from Pasadena as more powerful winds are expected to trigger new wildfires in California.

The fires could set back the recent progress made in containing blazes that have destroyed thousands of homes and killed at least 24 people.

#live #news #pasadena #california

items.title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire on 'brink' of 'finally coming to fruition,' Biden says
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
President Joe Biden says the Israel-Hamas hostage and ceasefire talks are on the "brink" of "finally coming to fruition." He says the deal frees the hostages, halts the fighting, provides Israel security and surges assistance to the Palestinians. Read more: https://bit.ly/4gU9dFw 

#biden #gaza #israel 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

items.title: Why some Israeli soldiers refuse to keep fighting in Gaza
items.author: Associated Press
items.content: A growing number of Israeli soldiers are speaking out against the Israel-Hamas war. They say they did or saw things that crossed ethical lines. Some 200 soldiers have signed a letter saying they’ll stop fighting if the government doesn’t secure a ceasefire. #shorts

items.title: Officials unveil security plans for Trump's inauguration
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
One week ahead of the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump, top officials in Washington, D.C. spelled out security plans for the event, which is expected to attract some 250,000 ticketed attendees.

#trump #news #donaldtrump

items.title: What do fans at the Australian Open think about Djokovic and Murray teaming up?
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
The recently retired Andy Murray has teamed up with longtime rival Novak Djokovic as his coach. Here's what fans at the Australian Open think about the pair.

#sports #tennis #australianopen #djokovic #murray

items.title: DeSantis calls special session to implement Trump's immigration policies
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
DeSantis announced Monday he’s scheduling the special session for the week of Jan. 27, the week after Trump is sworn in, so that state lawmakers will be poised to help implement the incoming president’s policies immediately.

#trump #news #desantis

items.title: Los Angeles wildfire deaths rise to 24 as more fierce winds are forecast
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Firefighters are preparing for a return of dangerous winds that could again stoke the wildfires that have destroyed thousands of homes and killed at least 24 people in the Los Angeles area. Read more: https://bit.ly/3WjkEye

items.title: LIVE: Supporters of impeached South Korean president rally outside his residence
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol rally outside his official residence in Seoul. Anti-corruption officials and police are planning another attempt to bring Yoon into custody as they investigate whether his martial law declaration on Dec. 3 amounted to an attempted rebellion.

#southkorea #yoonsukyeol #live

items.content:
Watch live as White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre and National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan brief the media. 

#live #news #whitehousepressbriefing

items.title: How are the ongoing Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks different than previous attempts?
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Israel and Hamas appear to be inching closer to a phased ceasefire agreement, officials said Monday. However, a deal hasn't been reached yet and there are a number of obstacles that could still scupper the talks in Qatar. Read more: https://bit.ly/4gU9dFw 

#israel #gaza #news

items.title: Israeli lawmaker warns father of hostage held in Gaza after he backed Netanyahu arrest warrant
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
An Israeli lawmaker warned a father of a hostage held in Gaza that his son will be left for “many years in the dungeons of Hamas,” after the father said he supported the International Criminal Court's arrest warrant for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

#israel #news #gaza

items.title: LIVE: Biden delivers foreign policy address on the work of his administration
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Watch live as President Joe Biden delivers a foreign policy address on the work of his administration “to strengthen America and lead the world.”

As Biden prepares to leave office, he remains insistent that his one-term presidency has made strides in restoring American credibility on the world stage and has proven the U.S. remains an indispensable partner around the globe.

#biden #news #live
